message: @all I didn't see any updates yesterday, but this morning I'm going to go ahead and start working on the "changed_tests_D3.md" file mentioned in the Important Notes in Deliverable 3 since I hadn't done that on Friday (https://www.udacity.com/wiki/ud494/project3del3?nocache#p3). Additionally they mention we can add additional tests if we want to (we won't be penalized for not doing so if we don't need/want to though). Aside from that and additional code cleanup/commenting type work today, the main thing is getting the GUI working and the tests passing for it again. Then we can decide if we want to implement Task 3 or not for the extra credit ;-).

@all Just pushed up the changed_tests_D3.md file going over the small corrections in that were needed in the tests: https://github.com/gt-ud-softeng/cs6300-summer-team22/blob/Deliverable-3/6300Sum14Project3/GradesTool/changed_tests_D3.md
I will lok at the GUiTests - must be a case of updating to Tony's implementation.
Anything else outstandin.
The GUI tests I think are the main ones at the moment out of the required parts
There's some minor cleanup/commenting I still want to do but that's not related to any functionality.
The last bit would be deciding if the extra credit part is worth working on
@MuraliRaju Should we be able to run the GradesToolGUI file directly as an application? In Eclipse I seem to only be able to run the GradesToolGUIController file and get the GUI to appear
@OmarRamos the main is in the controller - hence it runs from there.  We can move main anywhee.
@MuraliRaju In that case, it might be good to have it in the GradesToolGUI file instead (I'm thinking if they run their tests they might expect to be able to run that file and have the GUI show up).
@OmarRamos in that case their test becomes the controller class and will not call our guicontroller.  So it will still show up.
Our GUIcontroller is for us to test the gui class.
I take that back - I have some listeners in the controller class.
Listener called functions not listeners themselves.
How does that change things?
I will have to move those functions back to gui class.
Gotcha, OK
@MuraliRaju Just pushed up some changes (adding in comments and other cleanup) you may want to pull
Shouldn't cause any issues with your GUI stuff (I left those untouched on my end)

@all I'm taking a look at the extra credit for Deliverable 3, but unfortunately it brings up additional questions so I'm not sure if we'll be able to complete it or not, but I went ahead and posted a question on Piazza asking for some clarifications on a few points to see if we can get some additional info that way.
@MuraliRaju I heard a response back for my Piazza question so I'll take a crack at the extra credit portion. How's the GUI part looking...any questions/issues?

It looks like an easy way I might be able to handle the formula parsing will be use Java's Built-in JavaScript parser as described here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3422673/evaluating-a-math-expression-given-in-string-form so I'll try and take a crack at it from that perspective and see how it goes.
@OmarRamos gui is almost complete - added save functionality I overlooked earlier.  Modifying the tests and then will push.
Consolidated the classes as you requested also.
@MuraliRaju Awesome :-)
@OmarRamos how do I lookup what we submitted for Deilv2.
What do you mean?
What's in the master branch right now should be what we submitted in Deliverable 2
(that's what I used to compare against when I had to see what changes I made to the tests earlier this morning)
I lost some code...looking for the file I pushed last week. You modified for submit so I am looking for my code before you "skeletoned' it.
This should do it too: https://github.com/gt-ud-softeng/cs6300-summer-team22/commit/b4f69686fc897c5b498a0f9364c639703e0a4848 (I just went into the history for GUI file on GitHub)
@all strugling with making tests pass - for example the student list order in combo box keeps changing every time I run.  Will update after I figure it out.
@MuraliRaju Thanks for the update...I don't know if there's a way you can make sure the list is sorted by student name or not

@MuraliRaju I just pushed up code for the extra credit portion of Deliverable 3 that you might have to pull down (I modified GradesDB, added a new test in GradesDBTest2, and added a note in the changed_tests_D3.md file).
@OmarRamos OK - thanks.
@MuraliRaju I just heard back on my 2nd question on PIazza: https://piazza.com/class/huy90hs4g9g3jq?cid=888 so I'm going to go and update my code again to reflect Will's comments.
@MuraliRaju OK, just pushed up the modifications using Will's comments from Piazza

So you'll need to pull those changes down when you get a chance. I think I'm good now and whatever else you might need from my end just let me know and I can help test the GUI portion or provide feedback so we can get things wrapped up and turned in ;-)
@OmarRamos working on final test.
@MuraliRaju awesome ;-)

It looks like the Extra Credit methods in GradesDB should be integrated into the UI too. It would be a text box for the formula and the some spots to output the average and median values for the class and overall calculated grade for the selected student. If you can manage those additions too it'd be good ;-)
@all GUI pushed for review.
@MuraliRaju thanks I'll take a look ;-)
@omar is all the logic for extra credit implemented.

Yup, you would need to tap into getStudentGrade(student) to get the student's calculated grade, as well as getAverageGrade() and getMedianGrade() to get the Average/Median for the entire course. And setFormula(formulaString) to set the formula
All of those are in GradesDB
OK I will take a look.

@MuraliRaju The GUI looks good. The only suggestion I would have for the Save button would be this for the Save button (from Deliverable 2 Story Card 3):\nThe users of the tool can select a student and save his/her information in a file named after the student (e.g., LaraineSmith.txt) and saved in the current directory (i.e., the directory from which the tool is run).
